title: 105_hr3909
content: The Act is titled the "Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument Minor Boundary Adjustments Act." The Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument in Utah was established in 1996 without sufficient public input, leading to inclusion of unsuitable Federal land parcels. Certain parcels of Federal Land within the Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument may be better served by transferring ownership to the State of Utah or a local government. Boundary modifications are proposed for the Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument in Utah. The boundaries of the Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument in Utah are modified to exclude specific parcels such as Upper Valley Oil Field, Henrieville Town, Cannonville Town, and Tropic Town. The Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument boundaries in Utah are modified to exclude specific parcels like Boulder Town and lands near U.S. Route 89 in Kane County. Additionally, the East Clark Bench parcel in Kane County is included in the monument. Maps of these modifications are available for public inspection. The boundaries of the Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument in Utah have been modified to exclude certain parcels and include others. Maps of these modifications are available for public inspection at the monument office in Utah and the Bureau of Land Management Director's office. SEC. 4. LAND CONVEYANCES, GRAND STAIRCASE-ESCALANTE NATIONAL MONUMENT, UTAH. The Secretary of the Interior shall transfer parcels of land in Tropic Town, Utah to the town without consideration, subject to existing non-Federal rights. The land is described in Garfield County, Utah, including specific sections and townships. The Secretary of the Interior will transfer parcels of land in Garfield County, Utah to the State of Utah for inclusion in Kodachrome Basin State Park. The specific parcels of land include sections in township 38 south, range 2 west, Salt Lake meridian. The Secretary of the Interior will transfer parcels of land in Garfield County, Utah to the State of Utah for inclusion in Kodachrome Basin State Park. The specific parcels of land include various sections in township 38 south, range 2 west, Salt Lake meridian. These sections are designated as (D) NW\1/4\, W\1/2\NE\1/4\ of section 9, (E) SW\1/4\NW\1/4\, W\1/2\SW\1/4\ of section 11, (F) W\1/2\NW\1/4\ of section 14, and (G) SE\1/4\NE\1/4\ of section 15. SEC. 5. DISCLAIMER. This Act does not imply congressional approval of the Grand Staircase-Escalante National Monument. Congress intends to abolish the monument if a court determines the President exceeded authority under the Antiquities Act of 1906 in establishing it.
